Many years ago I became a Republican because I saw a party of fiscal restraint and smaller government. The distinction between the parties has faded and they have morphed into look-alike spending machines. During the last term, with the White House and control of Congress, my party set records for government growth and spending. After a successful election the Republicans have passed their first spending bill of $388 billion dollars (No chance of a veto). In this time of soaring deficits, the bill contains 11,772 special grants called "earmarks" totaling $15,780,623,000. Included in the earmarks are such needed items as a $950,000 recreation center, a $150,000 botanical garden, a $300,000 senior center, a $900,000 aquarium, a $525,000 quarry upgrade, $2 million to repurchase the presidential yacht (which J. Carter sold for $280,000), $100,000 for a groundhog weather museum, $25,000 to study mariachi music, $300,000 for the Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation, $1 million for a world birding center, and $250,000 for the Country Music Hall of Fame. While our children and grandchildren are being saddled with a huge debt load and entitlements coming on line, while we are pouring treasure and young into the quagmire of Iraq, while we wait through multicolored alerts for the next terrorist attack .... it is business as usual in Washington.
